hints.label: thm-ricci-metric-functional-full
hints.title: Ricci Tensor is a Metric Functional (Expanded Proof)
hints.content:
181: :label: thm-ricci-metric-functional-full
182: 
183: The scutoid-based Ricci tensor $R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}$ converges in the limit $N \to \infty$ to the Riemannian Ricci tensor:
184: 
185: $$
186: \lim_{N \to \infty} R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}[\rho_t] = R_{\mu\nu}[g[\rho_t]]
187: $$
188: 
189: where $g[\rho_t]$ is the emergent metric functional of the density.
190: 
191: **Consequence**: The Ricci tensor depends on the measure $\mu_t$ **only through** the metric $g_{\mu\nu}[\mu_t]$:
192: 
193: $$
194: R_{\mu\nu}[\mu_t] = R_{\mu\nu}[g[\mu_t], \partial g[\mu_t], \partial^2 g[\mu_t]]
195: $$
196: 
197: **Proof**:
198: 
199: **Step 1**: By {prf:ref}`lem-metric-scutoid-density`, both $g$ and scutoid geometry are functionals of $\rho_t$.
200: 
201: **Step 2**: By Regge calculus ({prf:ref}`thm-regge-convergence`), the scutoid Ricci tensor converges to the continuum Ricci tensor:
202: 
203: $$
204: R_{\mu\nu}^{\text{scutoid}}[\rho_t] \xrightarrow{N \to \infty} R_{\mu\nu}[g_{\text{Voronoi}}[\rho_t]]
205: $$
206: 
207: where $g_{\text{Voronoi}}[\rho_t]$ is the metric encoded by the Voronoi tessellation.
208: 
209: **Step 3**: The key claim is that $g_{\text{Voronoi}}[\rho_t] = g_{\text{emergent}}[\rho_t]$, i.e., the metric from Voronoi geometry equals the metric from the expected Hessian.
210: 
211: **Justification**: Both metrics encode the **second-order structure** of the walker distribution:
212: 
213: - **Voronoi metric**: Determined by local cell shapes $\propto \nabla^2 \log \rho$
214: - **Emergent metric**: $g_{ij} = H_{ij}[\rho] + \varepsilon \delta_{ij}$ where $H_{ij} \propto \nabla^2 V[\rho]$
215: 
216: If the fitness potential $V$ is related to the density via $\rho \propto e^{-V/k_B T}$ (Boltzmann distribution), then:
217: 
218: $$
219: \nabla^2 V \approx -k_B T \nabla^2 \log \rho
220: $$
221: 
222: Therefore:
223: 
224: $$
225: g_{\text{Voronoi}} \approx g_{\text{emergent}}
226: $$
227: 
228: up to proportionality constants and regularization terms.
229: 
230: **Step 4**: Since the Riemannian Ricci tensor is a functional of the metric and its derivatives:
231: 
232: $$
233: R_{\mu\nu}[g] = R_{\mu\nu}(g_{ab}, \partial_c g_{ab}, \partial_c \partial_d g_{ab})
234: $$
235: 
236: we conclude:
237: 
238: $$
239: R_{\mu\nu}[\mu_t] = R_{\mu\nu}[g[\mu_t]]
240: $$
241:
